messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: Spiderman / Superman
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/11/2003 8:12:25 PM Central Standard Time, ... He just turned five.  I can t quite explain his inflection here, but he said it slowly,
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/11/2003 8:12:25 PM Central Standard Time,
listdiva@... writes:


> "But I have a penis!"
>
>
>
> BRAVO!
> How old is he? That's such an awesome comeback!
>

He just turned five. I can''t quite explain his inflection here, but he said
it slowly, loudly and deliberately, wtih the emphasis on I (pointing at
himself) and PENIS. Poor lady was a bit fiberglasted, as a friend of our says, but
she'll survive.

Elizabeth

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: Spiderman / Superman
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/11/2003 5:35:55 PM Central Standard Time, ... That s what I m working on.  Not making me crazy.  I need to look at it like Nathan s hair,
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/11/2003 5:35:55 PM Central Standard Time,
kimberly_fry@... writes:


> I sorta had to *decide to like it* or I'd have gone nuts, since it's an
> almost daily thing. It's still not what I pick when I sit down to watch, but
> it no longer makes me crazy!
>

That's what I'm working on. Not making me crazy. I need to look at it like
Nathan's hair, which is really fairly long. It's his hair, he can decide when
to ask me to cut it. He calmly tells people he's a boy, when they are
mistaken. Once he told a woman at the store (when she said "What beautiful girls
you have") - "But I have a penis!" His hair doesn't bother me. I'm working on
my superheroes hangups.

Thanks.

Elizabeth


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: Spiderman / Superman
messages.msgSnippet: ... My son has always liked science fiction, shows and books -- Star Wars, Star Trek Voyager, Aliens v. Predators, Enterprise, Matrix, Stargate 1, etc.  I
messages.messageBody:
>>>>> I find it difficult to find the value in Spiderman, Superman, etc. This is my son's current "thing." <<<<<

My son has always liked science fiction, shows and books -- Star Wars, Star Trek Voyager, Aliens v. Predators, Enterprise, Matrix, Stargate 1, etc. I never used to be able to stand it, couldn't see anything "redeeming" about it. However, after watching it with him over and over and reading the books to him, it kinda grew on me. Actually, I sorta had to *decide to like it* or I'd have gone nuts, since it's an almost daily thing. It's still not what I pick when I sit down to watch, but it no longer makes me crazy!

Kim


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
